Question: Where can I get a drink? Oh...
Answer: Oh, uh. Well, we thought we wouldn't put the alcohol out till 11AM. It's just...common...decency.

Question: Cake?...You seem a little down.
Answer: I am. [laughs] I'm a mess.

Question: How about I fix you some warm milk with some bourbon?
Answer: Oh, that sounds nice.

Question: Lovely. Wait, where is this taking place?
Answer: The Murphy bed of my basement.

Question: What...is happening to me? [pause] The lines in your haggard face are paths that lead nowhere. Your hair is the fire of hell. [hugs Meredith] I sincerely hope you find a sexual partner tonight.
Answer: It's come to my attention that someone, who shall remain nameless, wants to switch desk clumps.

Question: Cathy wants to leave our clump?
Answer: Don't look. Who it was is not important...but she did say that your constant pranking and one-upsmanship is driving her crazy. She or he.

Question: It's so much closer to the bathroom, right?
Answer: Yeah.

Question: [talking loudly] Sorry guys, Jim! This package came for you, do you want me to put it on your desk?
Answer: That'd be great, thank you. [Erin throws package, it hits Kathy. She thinks it was Jim who threw it]

Question: Nine?
Answer: I got you health insurance.

Question: Yeah! Right? But with great perks come great responsibility, so I'm gonna be expecting a lot more from you...no more zoning out in your office.
Answer: Oh, great.

Question: You really have to say 'oh yeah' every time you eat a candy bar?
Answer: I can't help it, Oscar. It's just really good. [takes another bite] Oh yeah!

Question: [shows bloody hand] Does anyone have a first aid kit?
Answer: Check out this song I wrote: I'ma love you downstairs tonight... [overlapping chatter]

Question: [writing on board] Love letters, yes! I love it. What else can be done with paper?
Answer: You can write a book about chairs.

Question: [gasps] Shh! Did you hear that? Infinity! There is an infinity of things that you can do with paper! Now, who wants to buy some paper? [scattered applause]
Answer: Very nice. Very nice sales pitch for our clients that don't know what paper is.

Question: I'm talking about you guys! Who in this room, right now, wants to buy some paper? Let's get high on our own supply!
Answer: Andy, you want us to buy our own paper?

Question: Andy, you want us to buy our own paper?
Answer: Yes!

Question: Oh, hello Mr. Schrute. I'll tell him you're here. Can I get you anything at all?
Answer: I'm not here to be given anything. I'm here to take what is mine.

Question: Dwight? What are you doing here?
Answer: Gabe? You don't know?

Question: Gabe? You don't know?
Answer: Course I know.

Question: Gosh, Andy, you had a great quarter. Okay? Robert will understand. Eight hundred dollars is a rounding error!
Answer: So make that error!

Question: It's just, I really need a real accountant on this. [to Oscar] What do you say?
Answer: I'm leaving early today because tonight I have a trivia contest in Philadelphia.

Question: What?
Answer: It's only the biggest night of trivia of the year. There's a thousand dollar prize. I'm committed to my friends, they're committed to me.

Question: You know what? Go. Have fun.
Answer: There's a trivia contest at a bar in Philadelphia.

Question: Yeah? You like it?
Answer: Yeah.

Question: What?
Answer: We'd have to leave work, like, right now, to do this.

Question: Yeah. But not just bagels. All unwanted problems. Question: What's the most important appliance in your house?
Answer: Meat grinder.

Question: You know, Gabe? You could have gone with garbage disposal, incinerator or eraser, and instead you chose toilet. God bless you. You're an American classic.
Answer: Dwight. Today is not my day at all, I'm afraid. I'm not going to be able to meet with you, but I'm leaving you in the very capable hands of our COO.

Question: No, he's going to meet with you later. No, no, no. I don't want you to rush it, okay? Trust me. Meet with Bill. He's a great person to know. I'll dialogue with him tonight. [leaves]
Answer: CEO to COO. What a difference a letter makes.

Question: I don't believe this. What are you doing here, Andy?
Answer: You left us no choice, but, this should put a smile on your face. How would you like to be captain of the Dunder-Mifflin team? Although I reserve the right to overrule you.

Question: You left us no choice, but, this should put a smile on your face. How would you like to be captain of the Dunder-Mifflin team? Although I reserve the right to overrule you.
Answer: What? No!

Question: What? No!
Answer: I've got a quota to hit. I don't care how I hit it.

Question: And you guys thought this was a good idea?
Answer: I thought it was a fun idea.

Question: Wait, what? Everyone in here is gay?
Answer: Yes! It's a gay bar! So you guys want to go home now?

Question: Yes! It's a gay bar! So you guys want to go home now?
Answer: No. Nah.

Question: What does this say about you? That you followed me here? That you think you're going to win your sales quota? At a gay bar's trivia night? [laughs]
Answer: It says that I believe that my staff's intelligence and that I'm willing to try anything. [Oscar's friend walks up] Not anything.

Question: All right, first question everyone: Ray Charles famously had this state on his mind. What is its capital?
Answer: Oh, we got this!

Question: Let's reverse engineer this. You're a black singer. Where do you go? Somewhere where you're a novelty. Alaska?
Answer: Atlanta.

Question: How am I supposed to know what was on his mind? Ooh, what do blind people think about?
Answer: Okay, dogs, canes, signs, manholes, stairs, piano, darkness.

Question: What? No, no. Excuse me! Lady! Get anyone from the COO's office on the phone this instant!
Answer: This must be very frustrating.

Question: Okay, now, you're not an all-star of the NBA, but you did get your game on when you won the NBA's Sixth Man of the Year award in 2011. Who are you?
Answer: Jim, Darryl. Your time to shine.

Question: Well, I know Elizabeth Taylor's sixth man was Richard Burton. Is that helpful?
Answer: That's it. I'm going to go watch the boats on the river.

Question: Most of all, I believe that character is destiny. And my character is one that- wait why are you smiling?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: What's with the smile?

Question: What's with the smile?
Answer: You're doing great. You know, so good.

Question: Excuse me, sir, on the Dunder-Mifflin A-team? Excuse me, sir?
Answer: Yeah?

Question: Yeah?
Answer: I'm sure you're just checking your Grindr account... [laughter] but you can't check smart phones during trivia, it's against the rules.

Question: Sir?
Answer: I can't- I can't not touch it.

Question: So the best chance of hitting our mark is now in the hands, and brains, of Kevin, Meredith, Erin and Kelly. Do I like these odds? My answer is no.
Answer: Which one is it?

Question: Which one is it?
Answer: I don't know. All I know is the building.

Question: All right guys, time's up. Who was the relatively unknown patent clerk who discovered that energy equals mass times the speed of light squared? Looks like everyone gets a point for Albert Einstein. Oh wait. Except for the Einsteins. That's all right. Which means the top three teams are going to finish it off in the speed round. So let's get everyone some bells. In third place we have the Einsteins.
Answer: Oh yeah!

Question: Ring it in when you know it. First question: This man had a fatwa declared on him when- [Erin rings bell] Einsteins?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: What is it?

Question: What is it?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: I did my part, babe. I'm just the bell girl. [Oscar rings bell]

Question: Aesop's?
Answer: Salman Rushdie.

Question: Salman Rushdie is correct. [applause] Heading out to sea, sailors. On a square-rigged ship, the sale set furthest forward is called what? [Erin rings bell]
Answer: Princess Ding-Dong, do not hit that bell unless-

Question: Dial it back, this isn't Tail Feathers, okay? [laughter]
Answer: They haven't really improved on the Oreo, have they?

Question: They haven't really improved on the Oreo, have they?
Answer: No thank you.

Question: Let me tell you why I should be the next manager with a riddle: A manager, a salesman, a leader and a warrior walk into a restaurant. The hostess says, 'table for one?' How is this possible?
Answer: You were dining alone? All those people are you?

Question: You were dining alone? All those people are you?
Answer: Yes, exactly. Riddle number two: Who is going-

Question: Ah-ah-ah- your drive, your ambition. It would be wasted on a manager's job. And Florida, you don't want to live here. Even I don't want to live here. That's why I'm always at my place in Scranton. Florida is America's basement: It's wet, it's filled with mold, strange insects, alligators. Alligators are dinosaurs, Dwight. You know that, right?
Answer: N... it's complicated.

Question: [holds a medal to the light] This medal was my grandfather's. He received it for acts of courage. For excellence. It's a tribute one man gives another. I could give you a job, Dwight. Why not let me give you something even better? [holds out medal]
Answer: It's a job interview, not a flea market.

Question: The standard American analog scale has a maximum capacity of what weight? [bell rings]
Answer: Three hundred pounds!

Question: Are you sure?
Answer: Marie Cotillard exposes herself a number of times in that film.

Question: [holds up 'Robitussin'] Riboflavin?
Answer: Michigan. [Kevin holds up 'A Mitten'] The President of the United States is 'P.O.T.U.S.' [Kevin holds up 'P.O.T.A.T.O.'] John Steinbeck wrote The Grapes of Wrath. [Kevin holds up 'The California Raisins']

Question: You know what I thought would be fun? Is we do like uh, a switch-em-up maybe? Since only one of us needs to win, maybe I can get Kevin and Kelly and put together an all-star team?
Answer: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Andy, there is no switching teams.

Question: When I dropped out of school to watch more sports, a lot of people thought that I was nuts. Well who's laughing now?
Answer: Say 'Shalom' to your shrubs on this Jewish holiday that celebrates the new year for trees.

Question: Hey, is it true that you're not allowed to spend time with your girlfriend during the month of Tu Bishvat?
Answer: Uh, I don't think so.

Question: Alright, if you're not going to help us out by buying our own paper, could you sell eight hundred dollars more paper than usual today? That would be amazing.
Answer: Andy, it's the last day of the quarter. We've already called all our clients, so making that much in a day is going to be tough.

Question: Oh, will we get to see that look?
Answer: No, that's why...that's why I said think of it.

Question: Andy, we're gonna do our best. But you know what? At the end of the day seven point...whatever percent is pretty good.
Answer: Yeah.

Question: Have I mentioned that it's also quite good for amateur animation? [flips crude animation of stick figures representing him and Robert] Took me two weeks.
Answer: Oh, ugh. [stands and looks at meatball in chair] What is this, a meatball? Really? [Stanley laughs]

Question: Oh, ugh. [stands and looks at meatball in chair] What is this, a meatball? Really? [Stanley laughs]
Answer: It's always more fun to mess with Dwight with an audience. That was usually Pam so now that she's out I had to find someone else. Turns out that Stanley is quite the comedy fan. But not everything makes him laugh. He has very specific tastes. Through a painstaking process of trial and error, I've found out what he likes. And it's really weird.

Question: Are you ready for some meatball?
Answer: Aw, man. [Stanley laughs] This is not very clever, Jim.

Question: [Dwight finds stapler in giant meatball] Really Jim? Really? Very funny.
Answer: [to Phyllis] Oh okay. Good night. [climbs in to Dwight's car] What's the haul?

Question: [to Phyllis] Oh okay. Good night. [climbs in to Dwight's car] What's the haul?
Answer: Thirty-two meatballs.

Question: [phone rings] Dunder Mifflin. Jessica, hi! How are you? Oh yay, that's so great to hear.
Answer: I'm not going to be one of those exes who can't move on. They have their life and I have mine. I'm taking an Italian class. So far I've learned tortellini, spagettini, linguini... Well it's not so much a class as a restaurant, but I do Monday, Wednesday, Friday from seven to nine.

Question: Oh, who needs a house that size?
Answer: Big. Stupid. Pure chump bait.

Question: It's mid-recession in a depressed area of a faltering state and I've got the most expensive house on the market. The one percent are suffering too, people. I wanted it to be my Playboy mansion. A temple to wine, revelry, sex, intrigue... this was hot on the heels of Eyes Wide Shut, mind you. Then I met my wife, she moved in, made it her own. Now she's left me and forced me to sell the place. The ultimate insult? They're calling my speakeasy lounge a rumpus room. [Jim laughs] Does my turmoil amuse you, Jim?
Answer: I'm sorry, I thought you were making a joke.

Question: What could you possibly have found funny in what I said? What was the joke you thought you heard?
Answer: I guess I thought you were approaching it with more of a sarcasm than misery. Kind of laughing at your own pain, sad clown thing.

Question: Dude, what if, since you're feeling grumpy, we all swing by tonight and check out your indoor pool? [Robert laughs]
Answer: Kevin, no.

Question: What, as some sort of last hoorah?
Answer: Yeah. All of us in the pool, saying hoorah. Maybe the last one that says hoorah is it.

Question: Hey Oscar, was that you who just created a party out of thin air or was it me?
Answer: That was you, Kevin.

Question: You going tonight, kiddo? Cause I can give you a lift.
Answer: Oh, I don't know, Meredith. It seems like you shouldn't drive maybe ever.

Question: How do you know where I live?
Answer: Andy followed you home after the Christmas party.

Question: Why?
Answer: He wanted to make sure California didn't put it in you.

Question: Wow. Andy's such a weird stalker. Following me home like that when he has a girlfriend? I should get a restraining order. [squeaks]
Answer: [sticks a hand in the pool] Oh, it is warm.

Question: [sees Andy's hand in his pocket] What are you doing?
Answer: Hmm? Flicking a bug off my wiener. [they both laugh]

Question: Hmm? Flicking a bug off my wiener. [they both laugh]
Answer: Gross. I'm getting a drink. Do you want anything?

Question: Gross. I'm getting a drink. Do you want anything?
Answer: No, I'm good.

Question: How is everything? How's your car?
Answer: It's great. You know. Reliable. Great mileage.

Question: Is that so? How about this weekend we take that sucker to a duck pond or something? Maybe get caught in the rain?
Answer: Well, I can't. I'm going skiing with Jessica. you know, a couple of dopes on the slopes.

Question: No. What?
Answer: Hey.

Question: Uh oh, look at this. Red plastic cup, red plastic cup. How about that?
Answer: You know, you are just as dumb at night.

Question: What you doing?
Answer: I'm relaxing. Scram. [pushes her]

Question: Hey, Stanley. Um, what happened to my pants?
Answer: I moved them. Pants only need a chair if there's a person in them.

Question: Come on, don't you want to play?
Answer: Oh really?

Question: Oh really?
Answer: Yeah.

Question: Yeah, you want to play you little hick? [kicks her in to the pool, Erin screams]
Answer: Whoa.

Question: How many bottles? Three hundred?
Answer: [laughs] About twelve hundred. What the hell, grab a bottle. Less inventory for the lawyers.

Question: Really? Why?
Answer: I don't know. Maybe not. Just come.

Question: [laughs] You regret attacking me now, hick? Huh?
Answer: Stop it. Dwight, I was flirting with you. I was trying to use you to make Andy jealous.

Question: I'm not going to help you. Why would you choose me? Because I'm mighty? Because I'm the manliest man in the office? I'll do it. [he picks her up]
Answer: [giggles] Oh Dwight!

Question: [to camera] Is he looking? [shakes her head] Oh. You can stop.
Answer: Okay, you can stop.

Question: Whoa, you guys, I just found this insane engagement ring. Is anyone missing this?
Answer: The main stone's missing.

Question: Toby, what's compelling about this is the note of persimmon. Right?
Answer: Note? It's a symphony.

Question: Note? It's a symphony.
Answer: Okay, you have to join my wine-tasting club.

Question: Toby, you are playing a dangerous game. Guess I'm through the gateway now, though, right?
Answer: [to Val] You know, I don't think I've ever been in this exact angle before. I was scared at first, but I like it.

Question: You in?
Answer: Yeah, sure, sure. I'll be right in.

Question: What is the most romantic possible thing?
Answer: We can get some chicken fights going in the pool.

Question: Dang it! What the heck already?
Answer: Hey, Cathy. Chicken fight!

Question: Okay, yeah. Who's going to be my partner? Where's Jim?
Answer: I'm right here! [gets in pool] Cold. Cold. Come on, Cath.

Question: I can't believe you're wearing it. Are you not superstitious at all?
Answer: Shh. Of course I'm superstitious. What are you talking about?

Question: Shh. Of course I'm superstitious. What are you talking about?
Answer: The ring of a failed marriage might have some sinister energy, right? Am I just being silly?

Question: The ring of a failed marriage might have some sinister energy, right? Am I just being silly?
Answer: Oh, I don't think you're being silly.

Question: [comes up from under water] How was that?
Answer: Okay. Watch my toes. [does hand stand]

Question: Hey Val. Want a beer? It might taste better than that pool water you've been drinking.
Answer: No, I'm good. Thank you.

Question: Cool. [to Kevin] Does Darryl not swim?
Answer: That's racist! I don't know. But I would say, by looking at him, no, Darryl does not swim.

Question: One more?
Answer: Yeah!

Question: [muffled] Dwight are you okay? Hey, damn it-
Answer: [coughs up water] Erin, did we win?

Question: [coughs up water] Erin, did we win?
Answer: Sure. Sure we did.

Question: Ugh. Same old party, same old people. Am I right? Reminds me of Phyllis's birthday.
Answer: Ooh, do not remind me of Phyllis's birthday.

Question: I know. [laughs] But boy, that Erin. She sure is a ripe little tiger, isn't she? Rroww! And to think, I always thought of her as a second Meredith. Respectfully, I don't want us walking into a similar Angela kind of situation.
Answer: Mmm.

Question: Yeah. Oh wow. How did you know it was mine?
Answer: The Bernard family seal. Duh.

Question: Oh, you weren't going to do that?
Answer: Honestly Erin, I don't know what I'm doing. I... I just... I don't know. Thank you.

Question: Hey, um, I think you parked my car in. Is there any way you can move your van?
Answer: Oh, I'm sorry. When I got here, I put my keys in a bowl.

Question: Are you serious?
Answer: Robert, I want you to know, I'm here to rock with you as late as you want, man.

Question: Two pools. A divider. A bridge. Good choice. It says everything about everything, right Robert?
Answer: What's the water like?

Question: What's the water like?
Answer: Nice.

Question: Hey, have you ever been checked for scoliosis?
Answer: I don't know, why don't you check me Dr. Shrute. [laughing]

Question: You date a guy, you find out he was engaged to your coworker so you throw cake at him. It's over. You start liking him again so you ask him out with a puppet show. He says no. Then he follows you home to make sure that you don't kiss somebody. Then he ignores you at a pool party? Am I right ladies?
Answer: [Erin helps Dwight stretch his inner thighs] Yeah. Oh, yeah. Oooooh, yeah.

Question: You guys ready?
Answer: Bring it on guys.

Question: Ready?
Answer: I'm ready.

Question: Stress is like the uptight mayor or a town who's saying, 'Hey, we're uptight, you can't dance,' and then you have to be like, 'Oh yeah, Mayor Stress? Well watch this!' And then... we dance. Oh how we dance. [dances to Kenny Loggin's Footloose] Sex also works.
Answer: Hey! Jim's back from jury duty.

Question: How was jury duty?
Answer: It was pretty uneventful, actually.

Question: What was the case?
Answer: Uh, hit and run.

Question: Did you send him to the slammer?
Answer: Nope. Not guilty.

Question: Is it black? 'Cause that would be hilarious.
Answer: Why?

Question: Why?
Answer: You know.

Question: Would it be more hilarious than Angela having a Chinese baby?
Answer: A little bit, yeah. Right guys? Back me up.

Question: A little bit, yeah. Right guys? Back me up.
Answer: Eh, a little bit.

Question: Oh, did I win the pool?
Answer: Ah, no. Right month, wrong year.

Question: Come on, Judge Judy, tell us your case. What were the deets?
Answer: Mine was actually a pretty boring case, so-

Question: How could it be boring? You were there for five days. Titillate us.
Answer: Yeah, you owe us. I had to stay until six twice to cover for you. My wife got to the TV first, had to sit through damn Rizzoli and damn Isles.

Question: [whispering] Guys, I don't know how many of you have seen- Gabe? Bring it in. I don't know how many of you have seen a premature baby before. It's going to be really tiny, so please don't say anything offensive.
Answer: Got that, bimbo?

Question: Got that, bimbo?
Answer: Got it, bimbo. [Oscar knocks at the door]

Question: Yes?
Answer: Knock, knock. Oh!

Question: Oh... I don't- I don't want any- what are you guys doing here?
Answer: We wanted to say hi to the newest little Dunder Mifflinite.

Question: And the victim rode his bicycle into the left hand turn lane but the perp was already in the left-hand turn lane?
Answer: Mm-hmm.

Question: What's up, gangstas?
Answer: Jim was lying about jury duty. He was lying the whole time so he could go do yoga or go canoeing. I don't know what this pervert likes. Fire him!

Question: Okay, okay. [sits, exhales] But let's just say that Jim was lying about jury duty. You would have to fire him, right?
Answer: Yeah, sure, of course. I'd fire him to Timbuktu. [Jim laughs nervously]

Question: No, not after what I told Dwight about firing you. No. Here's what we're going to do. We're going to have ourselves a good old-fashioned cover-up. Have you ever heard of a Connecticut cover-up?
Answer: No.

Question: Do you know why you never heard of it?
Answer: No.

Question: Are you sure you can keep this under wraps?
Answer: They used to call me King Tut because I'm so good at keeping things under wraps.

Question: [pulls food truck up to where Dwight and Nate are standing] Where you want I park?
Answer: Okay, everybody, gather 'round. Got a real special surprise for you. [indicates Ernesto and assistant who are carrying empanadas]

Question: Como esta? [speaks Spanish]
Answer: Uh, I'm going to say 'I' when I'm talking for Ernesto, so instead of 'he says blah, blah, blah,' I'm going to say 'I say, blah, blah, blah,' but that's for him. Anyway, it was something like, 'He remembers Toby.' [makes face] 'I remember Toby.'

Question: Okay- oh, Jim. Hey, this guy look familiar?
Answer: Uh-

Question: Yeah but who remembers all their customers? I mean, I can name like three of our clients.
Answer: Okay, he remembers Toby, the most forgettable man in the known world. [Ernesto says something in Spanish]

Question: Great. And while we're enjoying these delicious empanadas, Jim, why don't you tell us your story again?
Answer: Why? Everybody's heard it.

Question: Why? Everybody's heard it.
Answer: Walk us through it. What time would you get there every morning?

Question: Walk us through it. What time would you get there every morning?
Answer: Hey, Murder She Wrote. How about we drop the whole 'Murder, She Wrote' thing, okay? Jim was at the courthouse for jury duty every morning. How do I know? Because I drove him there.

Question: Hey, Murder She Wrote. How about we drop the whole 'Murder, She Wrote' thing, okay? Jim was at the courthouse for jury duty every morning. How do I know? Because I drove him there.
Answer: Why?

Question: Why?
Answer: Why? Why? [looks at Jim]

Question: Why? Why? [looks at Jim]
Answer: Because my car broke down.

Question: Wait, wait. You live by the courthouse. So you drove from near the courthouse, out to Jim's house, and then back to the courthouse?
Answer: Thirty minutes out, thirty minutes back, easy hour. And I would watch that cute little tushie scurry up those courthouse stairs every morning and that was that.

Question: [to Ernesto] I'm sorry, do you have any American Mexican food?
Answer: We're getting buried out there. What was that stuff about the car breaking down?

Question: We're getting buried out there. What was that stuff about the car breaking down?
Answer: Well, I think you handled it pretty well.

Question: Okay, listen, all right? Dwight's on to us, he's going to figure it out really soon, so let's just get ahead of it, let's tell the truth.
Answer: [sighs] I don't even know what the truth is anymore.

Question: Is he really five pounds?
Answer: Mm-hmm.

Question: Nine pounds? Really? I thought you said five. You know what? I was under so many drugs, I felt like I was at a James Taylor concert or something, oh. So, what did you bring?
Answer: Oh yeah, I don't know if it's right, but-

Question: Uh, excuse me, can I have everyone's attention for a second? First off, I just want to say that I'm really sorry, I didn't know that my absence last week would have been a burden on any of you, because, though I did have jury duty last week, they did dismiss me early on Monday. And I think you're going to find this pretty hilarious. I kind of, uh, well, maybe took the week off.
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: Funny? No? Nobody laughing?

Question: Funny? No? Nobody laughing?
Answer: [laughs] You're screwed! Oh, it's happening. It's really happening.

Question: What the hell, Jim? I covered for your bony butt.
Answer: Pam really needed some help with the kids, so, I promise my intentions were good.

Question: All right, well. Let's get this show on the road, shall we? Allow me to give you a hand. [puts Jim's things in a box] Here we are. So long, clump-mate. I'm going to miss you. Truth be told, I never thought that this was how it was going to end. I always thought that I was going to defeat you somehow. But you've defeated yourself. [laughs]
Answer: Dwight, cut it out. I'm not firing Jim.

Question: I know what I said. Jim, you're in deep doo-doo. Do you understand? I have one thing to say to you, and I'm going to say it in front of this whole office. Look me in the eye. [gives Jim a limp slap]
Answer: That's it? This is crap! [dumps the box on Jim's desk and leaves]

Question: That's it? This is crap! [dumps the box on Jim's desk and leaves]
Answer: [on voicemail] You've reached Gabe Lewis, I'm currently indisposed. Leave me a message. Ciao. [beep]

Question: It's fine. Pajamas aren't supposed to be baggy, right? It's not the barrio.
Answer: The only premature baby in this room is the baby this baby ate.

Question: Really?
Answer: Angela.

Question: Oh, hey. Have you seen Gabe?
Answer: He went to the car or something, but he'll be back.

Question: Don't you want to see the baby?
Answer: Psh! Why? I know what Angela and the senator look like. I can mash that up in my head right now.

Question: Psh! Why? I know what Angela and the senator look like. I can mash that up in my head right now.
Answer: I promised I wouldn't tell.

Question: What?
Answer: She got pregnant before the wedding.

Question: How long before?
Answer: A month. [Dwight leaves, Oscar calls after him] You didn't hear it from me!

Question: Dwight?
Answer: Dwight.

Question: [to Cece] You want a giraffe?
Answer: Yes, I am brining my kids in to help me get out of this hole. And you all remember my beautiful wife, Pam.

Question: Split the difference?
Answer: Jim.

Question: What?
Answer: Hi.

Question: How about a little visit?
Answer: Wow, what a surprise. That's crazy. You guys get to meet the little heck-raisers.

Question: Did you say something about this one bringing in something for these people?
Answer: [gasps] Yes! Cece wanted to thank everybody for letting her daddy stay home with her all last week and play, so she brought you a little treat.

Question: Cookies?
Answer: No, but that would've been a really good idea.

Question: Wow, these are incredible. Cece, did you do these?
Answer: No.

Question: She says 'no' to everything. You know, she thinks my name is 'No.' Cece, do you want some broccoli?
Answer: Yes.

Question: Why am I shorter than the table that I'm standing next to?
Answer: There's cross-hatching in some of these. That's kind of advanced for a two-year-old.

Question: Cece, this is your big sister Kelly. Did you color this pretty picture?
Answer: No.

Question: Hey, Cece, why don't you draw another picture for us, exactly like this one, or at least in the exact same style?
Answer: You know what? I don't think you need to do things on command. That's very weird. I'll just take that. Thank you. I think we should just wrap up the show, kiddos. Right?

Question: You know what? I don't think you need to do things on command. That's very weird. I'll just take that. Thank you. I think we should just wrap up the show, kiddos. Right?
Answer: [cries] Mama!

Question: Need I remind you that we were together a month before the wedding?
Answer: That is completely untrue.

Question: Completely true. Remember? Angela. No.
Answer: You said that Robert was not fulfilling you-

Question: All done?
Answer: Yeah.

Question: Before I go, may I?
Answer: Sure. [gives Philip to Dwight] Watch the head, watch the head.

Question: Nurse, you know that baby in there, baby Philip? Cancel the circumcision.
Answer: Who are you?

Question: Who are you?
Answer: I just might be his father.

Question: [Philip is crying] I know, buddy, I know. Cece, you want to come? Want to come out?
Answer: No!

Question: Oh bud, I know. Do you have a pacifier or anything?
Answer: I'm looking, I'm looking for the pacifier.

Question: You want to grab her?
Answer: I'm gonna grab her, okay.

Question: I have a kid. Last week, Jim at home? That was no vacation.
Answer: Jim.

Question: Dwight, what the hell? You can't smoke in here.
Answer: Oh, right. [sighs] The office looks different now. Huh. Smaller. Maybe I just feel bigger. Hello Gabe.

Question: You had something important to tell me?
Answer: Oh, you know, I did but now it seems infinitely insignificant.

Question: Jim? Oh, right. Nah, forget it. He was doing it for his kids. I get it. Kids drive us dads crazy. Sometimes I feel like they're raising us. Am I right?
Answer: I would love for everyone to just forgive me. But, if that's not happening, I'm not averse to just buying them all off.

Question: Alright guys. You know how we all like the red licorice but it's always buried behind like a ton of black licorice? [points to pile of candy] Bought it all. Now it's like red city in there. So, enjoy it.
Answer: Mmm-hmm. Moneybags. Must be nice.

Question: So you effectively spent what...four dollars on the entire office?
Answer: Uh, I can't get a handle on it. Am I cheap or rich? I can't...

Question: Uh, I can't get a handle on it. Am I cheap or rich? I can't...
Answer: You're nothing. When I think about all the gas money I spent on you. Washing my car to make sure you-

Question: [interrupting] Alright. Well, enjoy the red licorice, and good riddance, right? [tosses black licorice into trash]
Answer: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa! So you're just gonna throw away perfectly good food?

Question: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa! So you're just gonna throw away perfectly good food?
Answer: It's not really food, right?

Question: It's not really food, right?
Answer: I'm really hating this Jim guy!

Question: When were you going go-karting with Darryl?
Answer: It's a lunch thing.

Question: Ok. Well, hey, you're not here. You don't know, Ok? It's intense. They made me eat black licorice.
Answer: I have a recurring nightmare that I've been wrongly accused of a crime and twelve of these idiots are on the jury. Stanley is fast asleep, Kevin eats the evidence, Phyllis's name is Allison but it really is Phyllis, Jim is foreman of the jury and pronounces me guilty. The cop takes me away and tells me that I've been a bad boy and we have sex in the hall. She leaves the handcuffs on. They take me away to prison. The guards are all women. [sighs]

Question: Hey, aren't you an actor?
Answer: No.

Question: Weren't you in Sweeny Todd last year with Andy?
Answer: Uh, no.

Question: You hired your actor friend to come here as a cop?
Answer: That is so offensive and ridiculous. I-

Question: Are you glad to be back?
Answer: Yeah. Yeah, I mean I could have used another week, or three.

Question: What are you doing here? You just had our baby. Our collective Dunder Mifflin...family baby. Four days ago.
Answer: I wanted to come back to work. Not everybody needs some long luxurious Parisian maternity leave. [removes coat]

Question: What?!
Answer: Damn girl! Your body!

Question: Really? I feel like this big rhinoceros. Anyway, I wanted to thank you guys for covering for me so I made some treats. I've got brownies and magic cookie bars.
Answer: [murmurs of delight as people shuffle toward the treats]

Question: Oh Angela, those brownies have walnuts in them and I think Kevin's allergic to walnuts. You're allergic to walnuts, right Kevin?
Answer: Extremely, but I'm gonna fight through it.

Question: When did you find time to do all this?
Answer: Babies sleep a lot Pam, if you feed them enough. Brownie Pam?

Question: Babies sleep a lot Pam, if you feed them enough. Brownie Pam?
Answer: Thank you. [takes bite] Oh my gosh. It's really good.

Question: What?
Answer: I think you're going to like it.

Question: That...[quickly] you got a promotion! [Dwight turns back] Right? I mean that's not the kinda thing you wanna read quietly at your desk.
Answer: If you make me head of sales one more time, I swear.

Question: And here's some facts for you. Did you know frogs can hear with their lungs? And that flamingos can have orgasms that last 30 minutes.
Answer: Ah! Love to learn.

Question: What do we have here?
Answer: Val knit me a beanie. But I can't if it's a 'we're just friends' beanie or a 'I'm hot, you're hot, let's get it poppin'' beanie. So I'm gonna up the ante, give her a clearly romantic gift, and we'll get to the meaning of the beanie.

Question: Really?
Answer: Mm hm.

Question: Does this have anything to do with what you were talking to Andy about?
Answer: God, you're such a spy.

Question: [clears throat] Notice anything different about me?
Answer: You're wearing the beanie. You like it?

Question: You're wearing the beanie. You like it?
Answer: Super comfortable. Like sweatpants for my head.

Question: I like to knit, don't hate. And who's that for?
Answer: Oh, this is a gift, for....my man Nate here.

Question: What?
Answer: Yeah.

Question: Can I open it?
Answer: No, no, no. Maybe just later.

Question: How'd you know?
Answer: Just a hunch. Your gift is on the way.

Question: My first task as special project manager Dwight Shrute? Assembling a crack team. I need people who are loyal. People who'll help me get an inroad with the gay Hispanic community. People who won't be missed. We don't need idiots, good for nothing's, methheads or... What's your name?
Answer: Kathy.

Question: Why? Does he think you're going to Florida?
Answer: I hope not. [laughs] Because I am not going. Two question marks?

Question: I hope not. [laughs] Because I am not going. Two question marks?
Answer: No, just do one. Two question marks is kind of aggressive. You know it's like wha-what?? Just do one.

Question: No, just do one. Two question marks is kind of aggressive. You know it's like wha-what?? Just do one.
Answer: You wanna take Darryl, Phyllis, Toby, Angela and Oscar?

Question: You wanna take Darryl, Phyllis, Toby, Angela and Oscar?
Answer: Yes.

Question: Can I interest you in someone less essential? Like uh a Creed or a Meredith perhaps?
Answer: Oh my god.

Question: Are you kidding me?! I'm supposed to get in an airplane with those nincompoops? We'd never get off the runway.
Answer: Alright, look. I gotta keep this office functioning somehow. So, I have put together a list, here's your team. Darryl and Phyllis you can have, but you're also taking Kathy, Kelly and Kevin.

Question: Kevin!? Kelly!? Kathy!? Andy just gave me a chain with three weak links. Have you ever tried to use a chain with three weak links? I have. And now I no longer own an arctic wolf.
Answer: Well, let's hear it.

Question: You wanna call someone? That texted you!? Do you wanna drive them away? I mean, ugh.
Answer: [on phone] This is Darryl.

Question: Oh, sorry I asked for the main shipping number. I just need the address for the warehouse? I want to send my girlfriend some flowers.
Answer: Your girlfriend? Is your girlfriend Val?

Question: Your girlfriend? Is your girlfriend Val?
Answer: Yeah, do you know her?

Question: Yeah, do you know her?
Answer: We're friends. We're friends.

Question: Cool. Um, so can I get that address or...?
Answer: Yeah sorry, I'm just looking for a pen.

Question: Why do you need a pen?
Answer: Back off! I got my reasons.

Question: May I have your attention please? Could Kathy, Darryl, Phyllis, Kevin and Kelly please join me in the conference room immediately?
Answer: Why?

Question: Why?
Answer: Oh, no big deal. It's just that you five have been deemed most deserving of a three week all expenses paid business trip to Tallahassee, Florida.

Question: What?!
Answer: Oh, I'm sorry Stanley, I can't share any more details with you. You see, Andy rejected you.

Question: Wait. Kathy gets to go? Uh, why does she even still work here? Pam is back.
Answer: It just feels like a slap in the face.

Question: I can understand your pain and your rage, but you know what? Andy is an honorable man, let us not question his choices. I'm sure he had his reasons.
Answer: We're not questioning his reasons. I just wanna know what they are.

Question: What are the criteria for going?
Answer: It might be innate goodness versus innate badness? But there's an easy way to find out. [knocks on Andy's office door] Oh Andy, gotta few questions for you.

Question: It might be innate goodness versus innate badness? But there's an easy way to find out. [knocks on Andy's office door] Oh Andy, gotta few questions for you.
Answer: Mooshie mooshie. [Dwight laughs]

Question: Uh, the Florida picks got out, and people were just kind of curious as to why they weren't picked and maybe you could just clarify?
Answer: Well uh...well the deliberations were confidential so...I feel like we should respect that.

Question: Respect it? You're trying to tell me Kevin Malone deserves more than Stanley Hudson.
Answer: Hey!

Question: Important? Oh because you and your enormous monster baby are so important to the branch.
Answer: My baby is not a monster!

Question: Guys. Guys. Guys. Come on, seriously? We cannot let this trip cause this kind of rift, guys!
Answer: Stop calling us 'guys'.

Question: Five to six hours?
Answer: Three to four hours.

Question: I have already picked my team: Darryl, Oscar, Angela, Phyllis and Toby and that is the team that I am taking. What's that? It's not up to me? I only have influence? Well, that's all Baltzer Gladfielder had and no one eats owls for Thanksgiving.
Answer: You have two young dynamic people in this office who know trends, who know youth. That's myself and Kelly Kapoor, you need one of us there.

Question: Or both?
Answer: Not both. Just one, me. Or if not me, Kelly. Ideally me. Again, youth knowledge. That's what you get when you put Ryan Howard on your special project team...or Kelly Kapoor. Again, not both. Thanks.

Question: Because I feel like that I'm in a place with my gambling rehab that I can finally start going to dog racing again. You know, just sitting, watching, enjoying the sport? Maybe putting down a few dollars if there's like a crazy mismatch or something...
Answer: Ok. Thank you Kevin, we'll let you know.

Question: When do we leave?
Answer: Thank you.

Question: Yeah, wow. It's almost like we're not all experiencing the same winter?
Answer: Florida Stanley smiles. Florida Stanley is happy to go to work. Florida Stanley is who you want on your Florida team.

Question: Hey guys, any spots left?
Answer: Erin, you wanna go to Tallahassee?

Question: Erin, you wanna go to Tallahassee?
Answer: I do. I really do. I think it would be a nice way to clear my head.

Question: Really? Oh, great. Good, ahem, good.
Answer: Now, is it too dark to say that Cici's having an operation?

Question: Now, is it too dark to say that Cici's having an operation?
Answer: I think you need to go to Florida.

Question: I was going to say good because I'll have all the help I need?
Answer: Yeah, that's what I'm saying. They're incredibly helpful, you're lucky to have them. I mean with them there, you probably won't even know I'm gone.

Question: Well, [Jim enters] No! No! Absolutely not! You are not going. Over my dead body, no. Andy?
Answer: Tuns, I'm really sorry. You're too essential to the operation here, I can't let you go.

Question: Hey, quick question: Do you shower at night or in the morning? Cause I wanna shower when you're showering. Save some water.
Answer: OK, listen up everyone, here's who's going to Florida: Kathy..

Question: What?
Answer: '.Stanley..

Question: Why is it so hot in here?
Answer: Hot? What are you talking about? This is a nice temperate Florida morning. Eighty-five degrees, seventy-five percent humidity. This is the exact environment you will be facing for the next three weeks of your life. Welcome to special projects orientation. The next three weeks of your life are gonna be the most miserable you've ever faced. They're gonna be hard, they're gonna be dirty. You're gonna wish you were dead.

Question: Hot? What are you talking about? This is a nice temperate Florida morning. Eighty-five degrees, seventy-five percent humidity. This is the exact environment you will be facing for the next three weeks of your life. Welcome to special projects orientation. The next three weeks of your life are gonna be the most miserable you've ever faced. They're gonna be hard, they're gonna be dirty. You're gonna wish you were dead.
Answer: But...

Question: But? There's not buts. That's it. You'll wish you were dead. You seem a little disturbed, you wanna stay here?
Answer: No no, I want to go.

Question: Is that the buzzer from Taboo?
Answer: SHUT UP MAGGOT! YOU DON'T WANT TO GO, RING THE BELL! RING IT! Ring it.

Question: How many of you have seen the documentary Deliverance?
Answer: How did a mosquito get in here?

Question: How did a mosquito get in here?
Answer: I released three hundred mosquitoes in the conference room, just temporarily. When I'm done, the frogs will take care of the mosquitoes. [Frog in plastic cage ribbits]

Question: Yes, when he brushes your soft supple cheeks with his worn leathery hands and says 'I'm gonna make you the seventh Mrs. Rosenblatt' unless you ring this bell. Ring it! Ring the bell. You wanna spend the rest of your life changing your husband's colostomy bags? Huh? Do you? Ring it! Wha-, [Jim slaps Dwight's forehead] oh. What was that?
Answer: Mosquito.

Question: Hey what's up? You called?
Answer: Yeah, you know I, I felt really terrible that you got me these lovely gloves and I didn't get you anything...

Question: Your mom?
Answer: Yeah.

Question: Uh. So I guess that was your mom who called me earlier looking for the address? Real deep voiced woman?
Answer: Yeah, that's her.

Question: She said her name was Brandon, I think. Your mom's name is Brandon?
Answer: [laughs] Yeah Darryl, my mom's name is Brandon.

Question: So, what is this special project?
Answer: Basically Sabre has tasked us with helping them branch into the retail marketplace. They want to set up their own version of an Apple store.

Question: You know what might be great? Is if instead of a genius bar we have a lounge area where people can ask questions about the product with other customers who liked it.
Answer: Yeah. And they should have a place where people can check their computers or printers before they see you so you don't have to carry it around like a dope. Like a coat check. [Dwight writes on whiteboard] Oh, don't write it down unless you like it.

Question: It seems to me that the Apple store is kind of like a party. So I think our question is: How do we make this a better party?
Answer: No. We sell business tools and the stores need to reflect that. They need to be all business. Let all the other stores look like a toy store.

Question: Dwight, is now a good time to go over what you expect of us?
Answer: [long pause] Yes. What are my expectations for the group?

Question: [long pause] Yes. What are my expectations for the group?
Answer: I have been given the responsibility to manage Stanley, a solid player, Ryan, who is capable of surprises, Erin, an excellent follower and Kathy, a probably not totally useless enigma. And, well, Jim. Under the right manager, that's not a bad team. Perfectinschlag.

Question: Me neither. Hey, will you put this coat on my chair? I just realized I'm not going to need it down there.
Answer: Yes, I will take your coat. And I will keep it with me, and I will sleep with it because it smells like you.

Question: [On phone] All expenses paid. Yeah, Jim's gonna be there. Their marriage is not good. Nobody knows better than me. Definitely we will. It's three weeks in Tallahassee, what else is there to do?
Answer: Today is the first day of Sabre's new project to develop a chain of retail stores. I am meeting my new boss, Nellie Bertram, head of special projects. Work starts at nine. Sabre HQ is thirty minutes away, driving the speed limit. Giving everyone twenty minutes to shower, plus fifty for Jim to style his hair, twenty for breakfast, forty for Erin to get lost between her room and the lobby, ninety for Ryan to do his morning ecstasy... We're already twenty minutes late.

Question: Hey, hey, hey, hey! Wake up! [Erin kicks him] Ow! Why are you sleeping that way?
Answer: Oh. I was reading the mattress tag and I fell asleep.

Question: Heeeere's Dwi- what the-? [sees trashed room] Oh man.
Answer: What do you think happened?

Question: What do you think happened?
Answer: Looks like Jim got mixed up with some bad apples. [sees 'IT WAS DWIGHT' written in lipstick on the door] Oh no, no, no, no. It wasn't me. I gotta find Luwanda at The Alcohol Club. Oh. [Jim falls out of the closet, Erin and Dwight scream]

Question: Cool, for your kids?
Answer: Yeah. It's weird being away from them. Never done this before.

Question: I'll have a bottle of the antacid. Also, I want to get a souvenir for my son, but his mother doesn't acknowledge my paternity. Do you have anything for that? Also, I want it to have a Florida feel.
Answer: What does he like?

Question: What does he like?
Answer: Power.

Question: Hey, are you okay?
Answer: I'm fine, okay? It's just stress. You know, 'cause I care about this project. And frankly the fact that none of you are vomiting or diarrheal right now I find very alarming.

Question: I'm fine, okay? It's just stress. You know, 'cause I care about this project. And frankly the fact that none of you are vomiting or diarrheal right now I find very alarming.
Answer: Who says none of us are diarrheal?

Question: Who says none of us are diarrheal?
Answer: Are you sure it's stress? Because I did poison you.

Question: Are you sure it's stress? Because I did poison you.
Answer: Very funny, Jim.

Question: Oh no, I'm serious. I was thinking, 'For this trip I have to do something epic, so what should that be?' and then I thought of it. I'll poison you. What are you gonna do? You gonna steal my newspaper or put a cricket in my cereal or something?
Answer: I'm gonna set your face on fire.

Question: That's a good one. [a red sports car drives up] Whoa, Stanley! Did you just come back from burning down a rival nightclub?
Answer: Laugh it up, Halpert. I'm in Florida for a month without my family. I'm gonna enjoy this. Want to get in? You can work the iPod.

Question: Laugh it up, Halpert. I'm in Florida for a month without my family. I'm gonna enjoy this. Want to get in? You can work the iPod.
Answer: Yes.

Question: Did I say 'Messina?' [tires screech]
Answer: Ahh! [laughs] Sorry I couldn't resist. It's so quiet.

Question: Hey, can you pick up the pin? Some of us like to work in our bare feet.
Answer: Of course, I will pick up the pin. It is right here. Got it.

Question: Can we see that? Did you really find it?
Answer: Yes, right here. Got it. Dink, ow. [chuckles, clicks tongue] In the trash.

Question: Hey, why is it so quiet? Shouldn't the phone be ringing? Uh-oh. Erin set the phone to voicemail.
Answer: Oh great. [overlapping chatter]

Question: Oh! There we go! Pam?
Answer: Yeah?

Question: Yeah?
Answer: Can you get the phone?

Question: Can you get the phone?
Answer: Well I'm not the receptionist.

Question: Will one of you get the phone? I am freaking out! I know it's for me. [Andy and Pam silently argue] Are you guys kidding me? Stop flirting and someone get the phone!
Answer: Somebody! Answer the phone.

Question: Fine. Hello, Dunder Mifflin. [ringing continues] Hello, you've reached Dunder Mifflin. How may I be of service?
Answer: Man.

Question: How was the drive?
Answer: Fantastic. Stanley drives so fast.

Question: Still queer?
Answer: Packer.

Question: Psst. Say, 'So who's leading this thing, anyway?'
Answer: So who's leading this thing, anyway?

Question: So who's leading this thing, anyway?
Answer: Psst. Say, 'I can't wait to meet him.'

Question: Him, you say? Don't think a woman can be a leader?
Answer: I-

Question: You poor, simple boy. Expected a man, did you? Strong, powerful. Huge, whopping penis? Well, sorry to disappoint, but my huge, whopping penis is right here, [points to her head] and I'm not afraid to use it. So stop looking at my breasts, and start looking at my penis. [slow clap] I'm Nellie Bertram, president of special projects. In the next few weeks we're going to throw everything you know about business out of the window and do it our own way. Are your minds blown? So, how did this special project come about anyway? Well, I interviewed to be the manager of your branch. [points to Jim] After you decided I wasn't 'a good fit-'
Answer: It was-

Question: Ah! It was. I went on a shopping spree. Very destructive. I bought thirteen pianos. Then I realized, what if Sabre had a store? Hmm? So I called Jo, old friend, founder of Sabre, and I told her and she grabbed me by the shoulders and she said, 'Yes!' So let's talk about the Sabre store then. Probably gonna look stupid, right? Like a big turd with a door on the front, right? What do you think it should look like?
Answer: Um, it might be fun if each store had a different theme, like a beach one, a winter one, a jungle one.

Question: Oh, no, it does. It does. It has to be winter, and I reject it. So I drew up a design concept. Probably gonna be rubbish, right? Would you like to look at it? Just so you could laugh at it.
Answer: Yeah!

Question: What is the antidote?
Answer: True love's kiss.

Question: I'll do it! I always say, 'You want something done right? Ask Dwight.' Right? Dwight. Right? Dwight. Right Dwight, right Dwight. Sorry, now you'll never be able to get that out of your head. [reaches up, whimpers]
Answer: I can do it.

Question: [on phone] Yes, a complete inability to pass gas, pervert. Ugh, yeah, it's tender. It can't be appendicitis, I eat more than enough bacon. Okay, what poison mimics the symptoms of appendicitis? Oh, you don't know? Hold on. [to Jim] What kind of poison did you use?
Answer: Dwight, I didn't poison you. I was kidding.

Question: Yeah, I'm gonna need an ambulance. Hold on, I have the address in my phone. [sees chart on screen] Hold on. Hold on one second. Uh, quick question. Vice president, uh, who is that? There's no name listed.
Answer: Is there not? Maybe I'm just waiting for someone to wow me. [winks]

Question: Is there not? Maybe I'm just waiting for someone to wow me. [winks]
Answer: Sir? Sir, where should we send the ambulance?

Question: Sir? Sir, where should we send the ambulance?
Answer: Send it to the frickin' moon, idiot.

Question: You talking about hunting? I love hunting. I'm a master hunter.
Answer: Did you say 'masturbator?'

Question: Did you say 'masturbator?'
Answer: I'm a decent baiter. My cousin Mose, that's a master baiter.

Question: Why are you sitting down like that?
Answer: Why is everyone else standing up? Okay team, let's get back to work! Break's over!

Question: Why is everyone else standing up? Okay team, let's get back to work! Break's over!
Answer: Wow. Are you that bored?

Question: Wow. Are you that bored?
Answer: It's just rum. I'm not bored, I'm a pirate.

Question: Is that another motto?
Answer: It's whatever you want. [offers Jim the bottle]

Question: Or do you only drink with your kids?
Answer: Ah, let's do it. [laughs] Oh, that's healthy.

Question: We have the Sabre Pyramid, right? Hmm? We've got a bunch of humans. You guys, humans... pyramid. Human pyramid. Do you follow? It's a team-building exercise. You'll love it. Who's in? Hmm?
Answer: Yup. Tallahassee, let's go.

Question: Jim, are you in?
Answer: Oh, I don't know.

Question: All right, what the heck? Let's do it.
Answer: This is great. This is gonna be great.

Question: Dwight?
Answer: Dwight, why don't we just hold off with the human pyramids for a while?

Question: Dwight, why don't we just hold off with the human pyramids for a while?
Answer: Everyone stop moving! Everyone stop wiggling! Oh, I feel like I'm gonna vomit!

Question: Oh! Who called it? Nothin' but net.
Answer: How long will he be gone?

Question: How long will he be gone?
Answer: Two or three days.

Question: Drama queen, am I right?
Answer: [to phone] Phillip, if you're hearing this memo, that can only mean one thing, I'm dead. You are the rightful heir to Schrute Farms. Please, you must do one thing. Kill Mose before he kills you. [presses button] Mose, hey, it's Dwight. Listen, yeah, I just want to give you a heads-up.

Question: That was an interesting diversion. Shall we get back to the meeting?
Answer: Whoa, are those mini pizzas?

Question: Whoa, are those mini pizzas?
Answer: Yeah, I figured we'd keep things savory while Oscar's mouth is in canker country. I also have some bacon-wrapped dates on deck.

Question: Look at these little mini pizzas. Does this make me look huge? [giggles] Hey guys, look at me, I'm huge.
Answer: Hey Darryl, good news, your fax went through.

Question: I just got out of surgery. What's going on? Fill me in.
Answer: Well, we broke into groups and the groups are doing presentations later.

Question: Who's doing the presentations?
Answer: Packer's giving one. [Dwight growls] Jim'll probably give ours, I guess.

Question: Let's see, what else have you missed? Ryan switched his name tag to his pants, so now it's like if you wear yours on your shirt, you're a total dip, but if you switch, you're a copycat. But I think I figured out a solution. What else? My shoes are gonna-
Answer: #NAME?

Question: #NAME?
Answer: Very good point.

Question: Dwight, are you all right?
Answer: I'm great. How are you?

Question: I'm great. How are you?
Answer: What's our presentation about?

Question: What's our presentation about?
Answer: Dwight, will you go back to the hospital? You were there for like three hours.

Question: Dwight, will you go back to the hospital? You were there for like three hours.
Answer: I got the surgery, what else is there to do?

Question: I got the surgery, what else is there to do?
Answer: Do a hundred jumping jacks.

Question: Stanley, are you listening to music?
Answer: Yup.

Question: All right, who's ready for the next presentation?
Answer: Ah, what is your topic?

Question: Ah, what is your topic?
Answer: What is our topic? Oh, what a topic it is.

Question: What is our topic? Oh, what a topic it is.
Answer: Retail consumer habits.

Question: Really? Okay. Retail consumer habits is... [sighs] The only thing you need to know about retail consumer habits is that consumers are mindless lemmings. They just want to be told what to do. [Erin makes the first slide appear] Fast forward to today, and the retail consumer is independent, well-informed, super smart. Super smart. Okay.
Answer: Shopping habits are both seasonal and cyclical. What does this mean?

Question: Shopping habits are both seasonal and cyclical. What does this mean?
Answer: I can field this one.

Question: No, sit down. 'Seasonal.'
